document.masterDocTitle: Mites of the genera Pulaeus and Lupaeus (Acari: Prostigmata: Cunaxidae) of Crimea, Ukraine

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Mites of the genera Pulaeus and Lupaeus (Acari: Prostigmata: Cunaxidae) of Crimea, Ukraine

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female (
Figs. 10–18
).
Gnathosoma
(
Figs. 10–12
). The chaetotaxy of the subcapitulum (
Fig. 10
) is the same as in
P . leonidi
sp. nov.
Ventral surface of the subcapitulum in the area of setae
hg 4
with transverse rows of lobes which laterally and anteriorly replaced by papillae reaching nearly to setae
hg 2
. Anteriad to
hg 3
a few longitudinal weak striae are present and oriented towards
hg 2
. Dorsal surface of coxal region papillated. Dorsal surface of the first and proximal two thirds of second segment of chelicerae with papillae (
Fig. 11
). Cheliceral seta present. Surface of palps almost smooth except proximal dorsal half of second segment covered by papillae (
Fig. 12
). The chaetotaxy of palps as in
P . leonidi
sp. nov.

Idiosomal dorsum (
Fig. 13
). The chaetotaxy as in
P . leonidi
sp. nov.
Entire surface of dorsal idiosomal shield bearing transverse rows of lobes. Setae
f 1
and
f 2
on each side are situated on sclerotized common platelet without lobes and with distinct borders. Setae
h 1
and
h 2
are situated on different sclerotized platelets. The length of each simple seta on shield is shorter than distance between its base to base of the nearest seta. Setae ve ,
f 1
and
h 1
are the longest among simple dorsal idiosomal setae. Their length is about 1.3-1.7 times longer than sci ,
c 1-2
,
d 1
,
e 1
and
h 2
which are subequal. Setae
f 1
is about 1.7-1.8 times longer than
f 2
. Dorsal cuticle with clear, long and smooth striae, except small papillated area anterior to anal opening between setae
h 1
.

Idiosomal venter (
Fig. 14
). The borders of coxal plates are distinct (
Fig. 5
). The propodosomal coxal plates are medially completely divided. Each coxal plate with 6 setae. A peg-like seta on the dorsal part of coxae I present. Genital valves with longitudinal rows of lobes. Genital setae (
g 1–4
) subequal in length. Setae
g 3
situated slightly laterally to row of setae
g 1–2
and
g 4
. The genital papillae are well-developed. Venter with 5 pairs of setae between hysterogastral coxal plates (excepting setae on coxal plates and genital valves). Integumental striae smooth, except small areas posterior and anterior to genital opening with numerous papillae.
Etymology. The new species is named after specialist in algology, Dr Ivan Maslov (Nikita Botanical Gardens- National Scientific Center).

Differential diagnosis. This new species closely resembles
P . glebulentus
Den Heyer, 1980
but it differs from the latter by subequal solenidia on the tibia of legs I (the distal solenidion noticeably shorter than proximal one in
P . glebulentus
). Also, the area of striation with papillae on the idiosomal dorsum of the new species is much smaller than in
P . glebulentus
.

Type material.
Female holotype , Ukraine , Crimea, “Cape Martyan” Nature Reserve, litter under
Juniperus excels
a Bieb,
12 .VI. 2001
(Coll. Sergeyenko, A.L.). Paratypes : 1 Ƥ, Ukraine , Crimea, Tyuptarkhan peninsula, in soil under wormwood,
20 .VI. 2004
(Coll. Sergeyenko, A.L.).
